intro: Lagarinthus flexuosus, commonly known as the wandering jew, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and vibrant, tubular flowers. The plant produces showy, often purple or red flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its foliage is typically heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Lagarinthus flexuosus is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
